question: What are the names of mentioned capital improvement projects?
raw_provenance:
Public Works Commission
Agenda Report

Public Works
Commission Meeting
04-28-21
Item
4.A.

To:

Chair Merrick and Members of the Public Works Commission

Prepared by:

Troy Spayd, Assistant Public Works Director/City Engineer

Date prepared: April 15, 2021

Meeting date: April 28, 2021

Subject:

Capital Improvement Projects and Disaster Recovery Projects Status
Report

RECOMMENDED ACTION: Receive and file report on the status of the Cityâ€™s current and
upcoming Capital Improvements Projects and Disaster Recovery Projects.

DISCUSSION: Staff will provide a status update on the following active projects in the
Fiscal Year 2020-2021 Capital Improvement Program:

Capital Improvement Projects (Design)

Marie Canyon Green Streets
(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) The City has recently received Measure W funds to complete this
project. Staff is working on the project plans to prepare for public
bidding.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Civic Center Way was reopened to the public on April 8th. While being
open, many project related items will continue. This will include
intermittent traffic control (lane closures). The remaining items includes
final paving, striping, irrigation, painting, planting material, clean-up,
and final detailing.

(cid:190) Project Schedule: August 2020 through April 2021

Page 3 of 6

Agenda Item # 4.A.










Capital Improvement Projects (Not Started)

Bluffs Park Shade Structure

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of the installation of four single-post

shade structures at Malibu Bluffs Park

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Summer 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Fall 2021

Vehicle Protection Devices

(cid:131) Complete Design: May 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Winter 2021

PCH Median Improvements Project

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) Consultant is working on the final design. In March, the City be seeking
proposals from consultants to perform construction management.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Spring 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Fall 2021

Page 1 of 6

Agenda Item # 4.A.


















PCH Signal Synchronization System Improvements Project

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) 65% design package was submitted to Caltrans in November 2020 and

we are still awaiting comments to those plans.
(cid:131) Consultant is working on final design documents.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Final Design: May 2021
(cid:131) Advertise: July 2021
(cid:131) Award Contract and Begin Construction: September 2021

Civic Center Stormwater Diversion Structure

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) The project assessment engineer has begun the process of evaluating

the project costs.

(cid:131) Staff is rescheduling the community meeting to May 2021.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: December 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: March 2022

Page 2 of 6

Agenda Item # 4.A.







Malibu Park Drainage Improvements

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) Staff made minor modifications to the project plans to reduce the

overall project costs.

(cid:131) Project is out to bid with bids due April 21, 2021.

(cid:190) Project Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: March 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: June/July 2021

Annual Street Maintenance

(cid:190) Project Description: This project provides for the reconstruction and

maintenance of City streets.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:

(cid:131) Complete Design: Spring 2021
(cid:131) Begin Construction: Summer 2021

Capital Improvement Projects (Construction)

City Hall Roof Replacement

Corral Canyon Road Bridge Repairs (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consisted of replacing fire damaged existing
fencing and repairing the damaged embankment adjacent to the bridge.

Corral Canyon Culvert Repairs (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consisted of replacing a portion of Corral

Canyon Road that was damaged from a failed storm drain.

Page 5 of 6

Agenda Item # 4.A.












Disaster Projects (Not Started)
Clover Heights Storm Drain (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of design and construction of a few
storm drains on Clover Heights. The existing storm drain facility ends at the
intersection of Clover Heights and Harvester Road. During storms, this
intersection floods and causes debris to block the road. An extended storm
drain towards the end of Clover Heights will help eliminate this issue.

(cid:190) Estimated Schedule:
evidence:
Civic Center Stormwater Diversion Structure Updates: 
  - Consultant is working on the final design.
In March, the City be seeking proposals from consultants to perform construction management.

PCH Median Improvements Project Updates: 
  - Consultant is working on the final design.
In March, the City be seeking proposals from consultants to perform construction management.
Corral Canyon Road Bridge Repairs (FEMA Project) Project Description: This project consisted of replacing fire damaged existing fencing and repairing the damaged embankment adjacent to the bridge.
Clover Heights Storm Drain (FEMA Project) Project Description: This project consists of design and construction of a few storm drains on Clover Heights.
The existing storm drain facility ends at the intersection of Clover Heights and Harvester Road.
During storms, this intersection floods and causes debris to block the road.
An extended storm drain towards the end of Clover Heights will help eliminate this issue.
raw_answer: Bluffs Park Shade Structure, Vehicle Protection Devices, PCH Median Improvements Project, Civic Center Stormwater Diversion Structure, City Hall Roof Replacement, Corral Canyon Road Bridge Repairs, Clover Heights Storm Drain.
evidence_answer: Civic Center Stormwater Diversion Structure Updates, PCH Median Improvements Project Updates, Corral Canyon Road Bridge Repairs, Clover Heights Storm Drain
